ccre.ctrl

Class ExtendedMotor

  • java.lang.Object
    • ccre.ctrl.ExtendedMotor
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CommunicationFailureExtendedMotor

    public abstract class ExtendedMotor
extends java.lang.Object
    Sometimes there's more to control about a motor than just a power level, and so FloatOutput is insufficient. That's where ExtendedMotor comes in. An example of an ExtendedMotor would be a CAN Jaguar or CAN Talon. An extended motor may have one or more Diagnostics (error reports, such as faults), Statuses (state reports, such as voltage), and Control Modes (methods of controlling an output, such as voltage-based or current-based.) It may also be disabled and enabled. It may also have an internal PID state.
    Author:
    skeggsc

    • Method Detail

      • enable

        public abstract void enable()
                     throws ExtendedMotorFailureException
        Enables the output, if possible. A control mode should be specified first.
        Throws:
        ExtendedMotorFailureException - if the output cannot be enabled.

      • disable

        public abstract void disable()
                      throws ExtendedMotorFailureException
        Disables the output, if possible.
        Throws:
        ExtendedMotorFailureException - if the output cannot be disabled.

      • asEnable

        public abstract BooleanOutput asEnable()
        Constructs a BooleanOutput to control the enablement status. A control mode should be specified before enabling.
        Returns:
        a BooleanOutput controlling whether this controller is enabled.

      • asMode

        public abstract FloatOutput asMode(ExtendedMotor.OutputControlMode mode)
                            throws ExtendedMotorFailureException
        Opens the controller in the specified output mode. This may override any previous output modes, so don't use any previous results from this method once it has been called.
        Parameters:
        mode - the mode to put the controller into.
        Returns:
        the output representing the controller. The meaning is based on the mode, or null if this mode is not allowed for this device.
        Throws:
        ExtendedMotorFailureException - if an error occurs while opening the output with this mode.

      • asStatus

        public abstract FloatInputPoll asStatus(ExtendedMotor.StatusType type)
        Gets access to one of the status readouts from the ExtendedMotor.
        Parameters:
        type - the type of status to get access to.
        Returns:
        the FloatInputPoll representing this status readout, or null if it cannot be acquired.

      • getDiagnostics

        public abstract java.lang.Object getDiagnostics(ExtendedMotor.DiagnosticType type)
        Gets the current diagnostic value from the ExtendedMotor. This is usually either an Integer or a Boolean based on the DiagnosticType.
        Parameters:
        type - the type of diagnostic to read.
        Returns:
        the current diagnostic value.

      • getDiagnosticChannel

        public BooleanInputPoll getDiagnosticChannel(ExtendedMotor.DiagnosticType type)
        Gets a channel representing a boolean diagnostic channel.
        Parameters:
        type - the type of diagnostic to monitor.
        Returns:
        a channel representing the diagnostic state, or null if it cannot be acquired.

      • hasInternalPID

        public abstract boolean hasInternalPID()
        Checks if internal PID is included in this ExtendedMotor. This does not necessarily mean that it is in use - the output mode must support PID. This may return either true or false if the current output mode does not support PID but the ExtendedMotor does in other cases.
        Returns:
        if internal PID is included.

      • setInternalPID

        public abstract void setInternalPID(float P,
                  float I,
                  float D)
                             throws ExtendedMotorFailureException
        Sets the internal PID tuning in this ExtendedMotor. Don't call this unless hasInternalPID() returns true.
        Parameters:
        P - the proportional factor in the tuning.
        I - the integral factor in the tuning.
        D - the derivative factor in the tuning.
        Throws:
        ExtendedMotorFailureException - if the PID cannot be set.
